target_key: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
title: National Restoration Targets
The Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017
rows: The Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017

The objective of the The Conservation of Habitat and Species Regulations 2017 is to protect biodiversity through the conservation of natural habitats and species of wild fauna and flora. The Regulations 2017 lay down rules for the protection, management and exploitation of such habitats and species. The Regulations 2017 transpose the EU Habitats Directive and elements of the Birds Directive in England, Wales and, to a limited extent, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

title: Changes to the Habitats Regulations 2017
rows: The changes are made by the Conservation of Habitats and Species (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019. Most of these changes involved transferring functions from the European Commission to the appropriate authorities in England and Wales.

title: The Conservation (Natural Habitats, etc.) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995
rows: The Conservation (Natural Habitats, etc.) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995
Protects certain birds, plants, animals, marine life and their habitats, including Natura 2000 sites, through creating criminal offences and changing planning requirements.

title: The Conservation (Natural Habitats, etc.) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
rows: The Conservation (Natural Habitats, etc.) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012

Amends 1995/380 to transpose certain obligations contained in the EU Wild Birds Directive and the EU Habitats Directive and generally place duties on public bodies to take measures to preserve, maintain and re-establish habitat for wild birds.

title: The Conservation of Offshore Marine Habitats and Species Regulations 2017
rows: The Conservation of Offshore Marine Habitats and Species Regulations 2017
The Conservation of Offshore Marine Habitats and Species Regulations 2017

title: The Conservation (Natural Habitats, &c.) Regulations 1994
rows: Regulates how to designate a site as a special area of conservation, imposes a duty to compile and maintain a list of European sites, specifies powers to make special nature conservation order and powers of compulsory acquisition, legislates protection of animals and plants, etc.

title: The Conservation (Natural Habitats, &c.) (EU Exit) (Scotland) (Amendment) Regulations 2019
rows: This amends the Conservation (Natural Habitats, &c.) Regulations 1994 (the 1994 Regulations) to ensure that they continue to operate effectively following UK's withdrawal from the EU.

title: The Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) Regulations 2009
rows: The Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) Regulations 2009

The Regulations implement EU Directive 2004/35/EC on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage. They impose obligations on operators of economic activities requiring them to prevent, limit or remediate environmental damage. The Regulations apply only to the more serious damage as defined.

title: The Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2015
rows: The Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2015

These Regulations amend the Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) (Wales) Regulations 2009 to implement the changes to the Environmental Liability Directive introduced by Article 38 of Directive 2013/30/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the safety of offshore oil and gas operations and amending Directive 2004/56/EC. Article 38 of Directive 2013/30/EU extends the definition of environmental damage to include damage to the environmental status of marine waters as defined in Directive 2008/56/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a framework for community action in the field of marine environmental policy, such that that status is significantly adversely affected.

title: The Environmental Liability (Scotland) Regulations 2009
rows: The purpose of the legislation is to implement the Directive 2004/35/CE of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 April 2004 on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage. The main aim of the Regulations is to establish a new kind of civil mechanism to be deployed in the cases foreseen by the Directive, based upon the polluter pays principle.

title: The Environmental Liability (Prevention and Remediation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009
rows: The Environmental Liability (Prevention and Remediation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009

EU Directive 2004/35/EC has the objective of making operators of activities which cause environmental damage financially liable for that damage (the polluter pays principle). The Regulations apply to serious environmental damage to land, water and to species and habitats. They cover not only species and habitats protected by the Birds and Habitats Directives but also any other species and habitats protected in Areas of Special Scientific Interest (ASSIs).

title: Mineral Workings Act 1951
rows: An Act to establish a fund for the purpose of financing the restoration of land in England used for the working of ironstone by opencast operations and to provide for payments to and from that fund; to make provision for the reclamation, cultivation, afforestation or other treatment of such land; to provide for setting off the development charge in respect of certain minerals against payments under Part VI of the Town and Country Planning Act 1947, or Part V of the Town and Country Planning (Scotland) Act 1947, in respect of interests therein, for the modification of certain mining leases and orders granting working rights, and for the application of section eighty-one of the Town and Country Planning Act 1947, and section seventy-eight of the Town and Country Planning (Scotland) Act 1947, to certain minerals of the National Coal Board; to authorise the temporary stopping up or diversion of highways for the purpose of working minerals by opencast operations; and for purposes connected with the matters aforesaid.

title: Environmental Protection Act 1990
rows: An Act to make provision for the improved control of pollution arising from certain industrial and other processes; to restate the law defining statutory nuisances and improve the summary procedures for dealing with them; specifies duty of enforcing authority to require remediation of contaminated land etc.

title: Environment Act 2021
rows: Defines 'conservation covenant agreement' between a landowner and a responsible body to conserve the setting of land with a natural environment or natural resources or which is a place of archaeological, architectural, artistic, cultural or historic interest.

title: Land Reform (Scotland) Act 2003
rows: An Act of the Scottish Parliament to establish statutory public rights of access to land for recreational and other purposes, and to extend some of the provisions for that purpose to rights of way and other rights; to make provision under which bodies representing rural and crofting communities may buy the land with which those communities have a connection; and for connected purposes.

title: Community Empowerment (Scotland) Act 2015
rows: An Act of the Scottish Parliament to make provision about national outcomes; to amend Parts 2 and 3 of the Land Reform (Scotland) Act 2003; to enable certain bodies to buy abandoned, neglected or detrimental land; to make provision for registers of common good property and about disposal and use of such property; to restate and amend the law on allotments; etc.

title: Law no. 9587, dated 20.7.2006 On the protection of biodiversity, as amended
rows: Law no. 9587, dated 20.7.2006 On the protection of biodiversity, as amended

This law aims to: 1. To ensure the protection and preservation of biological diversity. 2. To regulate the sustainable use of biological diversity components, through the integration of the main elements of biodiversity in strategies, plans, programs and decision-making at all levels. 3. To ensure the establishment of the network for the preservation of natural habitats and flora and fauna wild in the territory of the Republic of Albania. 4. To determine measures to maintain or restore to a favorable conservation status natural habitats and types of wild fauna of Albania and of interest to the European Community. 5. To ensure that the measures undertaken, in implementation of this law, take into consideration economic, social and cultural requirements, as well as regional characteristics.

title: Law No. 91, dated 28/02/2013 On environmental impact assessment
rows: Law No. 91, dated 28/02/2013 On environmental impact assessment

The purpose of the law is to ensure high environmental protection and sustainable development, through the inclusion of environmental issues during the drafting, approval, revision, amendment or modification of plans or programs with possible negative consequences on the environment. The law defines the institutions and their rights and responsibilities, as well as the procedures, according to which the strategic environmental assessment is carried out.

title: Law No. 81, dated 04/05/2017 On protected areas
rows: Law No. 81, dated 04/05/2017 On protected areas

This law aims to specify, administer and manage the use of sustainable environmental protection areas and their natural and biological resources, through: a) identification, definition and addition of environmental protection areas or the expansion of those existing; b) preservation, rehabilitation and renewal of ecosystems of natural habitats, species, reserves and natural landscapes within environmental protection areas; c) sustainable use of environmental protection areas, integrating its elements in strategies, plans, programs and decision-making of all levels.

title: Law no. 57/2020, dated 30.4.2020 "On forests"
rows: The purpose of this law is the protection of forests as assets of special importance. The law aims to contribute to the sustainable development of the forests sector and to preserve, increase the area and increase the total volume of the national forest fund. The law ensures the guarantee of services quality, aiming at the proper protection, improvement and regeneration of forest space.

title: Law No. 10431, dated 09/06/2011 On environmental protection
rows: Law No. 10431, dated 09/06/2011 On environmental protection
This law defines the principles, requirements, responsibilities, rules and procedures of general for guaranteeing protection at a high level of the environment in the Republic of Albania.

title: Environmental Protection Act
rows: The Act regulates the protection of the environment from pollution as a fundamental condition for sustainable development. It defines the fundamental principles of environmental protection, environmental protection measures, monitoring of the state of the environment and information about the environment, economic and financial instruments for environmental protection, public services for environmental protection and others with protection environment related issues.

title: Environmental Protection Act - ZVO 2
rows: The Act regulates preservation of biodiversity, natural balance and natural values, elimination of the consequences of burdening the environment, improvement of the disturbed natural balance and re-establishment of its regeneration capabilities.

title: Uredba o obremenjevanju tal z vnaanjem odpadkov - Decree on burdening of soil with waste spreading
rows: Uredba o obremenjevanju tal z vnaanjem odpadkov - Decree on burdening of soil with waste spreading

This regulation determines the conditions related to the loading of the soil by the introduction of waste and mandatory conduct in the planning and implementation of the introduction of earth excavation or artificially prepared soil in order to improve the ecological condition of the soil.

title: Ordinance on the areas of the highest environmental burden and on the programme of measures for improving the quality of the environment in Zgornja Meika dolina
rows: Ordinance on the areas of the highest environmental burden and on the programme of measures for improving the quality of the environment in Zgornja Meika dolina

This decree defines the areas in the Zgornja Meika valley for which a program of measures to improve the quality of individual parts of the environment must be adopted and implemented. This decree also specifies the types of measures to be taken to improve the quality of the environment in these areas, such as replacement of contaminated soil and planting of grass in public areas,

title: Decree on types of measures for remediation of environmental damage
rows: Decree on types of measures for remediation of environmental damage

This regulation determines the types of remedial measures and the method of selecting the most appropriate measures for the remediation of environmental damage caused to protected species, their habitats and habitat types, waters or soil. The purpose of implementing measures to rehabilitate environmental damage is to restore damaged special parts of the environment or their impaired functions to the reference state, or to come as close as possible to it, and to compensate for temporary losses of special parts of the environment or their functions in the time until recovery to the reference state.

title: Rules on the content defining environmental damage
rows: Rules on the content defining environmental damage

This rulebook establishes more detailed criteria for determining major adverse impacts on the achievement or maintenance of a favourable state of certain protected wild plant and animal species, their habitats and habitat types, which are preferentially maintained in a favourable state, due to the determination of environmental damage.

title: Decree on the area of the Ljubljansko polje aquifer and its hydrographic reserves at risk from plant protection products and volatile chlorinated hydrocarbons
rows: Decree on the area of the Ljubljansko polje aquifer and its hydrographic reserves at risk from plant protection products and volatile chlorinated hydrocarbons
This regulation defines the area of

title: On the protection of soil fertility for agricultural land
rows: On the protection of soil fertility for agricultural land

The law regulates relations in the field of soil protection, fertility, quality preservation and protection from degradation and other negative phenomena associated with the possession, use, and disposal of agricultural land.

title: Law on the Pastures
rows: Law is about regulation the management of pastures, their use and improvements.

title: An Act respecting the conservation of wetlands and bodies of water, SQ 2017, c 14
rows: An Act respecting the conservation of wetlands and bodies of water, SQ 2017, c 14

The Act respecting the conservation of wetlands and bodies of water, introduced in Canada on 6 April 2017, aims to conserve and restore wetlands and bodies of water. It provides measures to prevent degradation, regulate activities impacting these ecosystems, and promotes collaboration among governments and Indigenous communities. The legislation plays a key role in preserving natural habitats and supporting land and ecosystem restoration efforts in Canada.

title: An Act to amend the Natural Heritage Conservation Act and other provisions, SQ 2021, c 1
rows: An Act to amend the Natural Heritage Conservation Act and other provisions, SQ 2021, c 1

This legislation amends the Natural Heritage Conservation Act and introduces changes related to land and ecosystem restoration. It proposes creating a register for areas covered by conservation measures. It establishes procedures for setting aside land for protected areas and amends the designation process. New protected area statuses are introduced, and the recognition process for nature reserves is changed. The legislation clarifies inspection and investigation powers, introduces penalties, and increases fines. It also amends other related acts and regulations. Overall, it aims to enhance the conservation of natural heritage and promote sustainable practices.

title: An Act to Provide For the Conservation and Sustainable Use of Biodiversity in Nova Scotia
rows: An Act to Provide For the Conservation and Sustainable Use of Biodiversity in Nova Scotia

The Biodiversity Act in Nova Scotia aims to protect and sustainably manage biodiversity. It emphasizes conservation, restoration, and reducing pressures on biodiversity. The Department of Natural Resources and Renewables oversees its implementation, working with other departments. The act enables the development of policies, guidelines, and programs, as well as the establishment of biodiversity management zones. It promotes research, education, monitoring, and information sharing to support biodiversity conservation.

title: ACT TO AFFIRM THE COLLECTIVE NATURE OF WATER RESOURCES AND TO PROMOTE BETTER GOVERNANCE OF WATER AND ASSOCIATED ENVIRONMENTS
rows: ACT TO AFFIRM THE COLLECTIVE NATURE OF WATER RESOURCES AND TO PROMOTE BETTER GOVERNANCE OF WATER AND ASSOCIATED ENVIRONMENTS

The Act affirms water resources as collective and aims to improve their governance. It promotes sustainable management and emphasizes the protection and restoration of water-related ecosystems, including wetlands and aquatic habitats. It encourages sustainable land use practices to prevent pollution and degradation. Overall, the Act ensures sustainable water use, ecosystem restoration, and community well-being.

title: Forest Act 1975
rows: This act of federal law regulates the preservation of the forest and the forest floor, specifies the treatment of forests which preserve the productive power of the soil, and ensures sustainable forest management.

title: Environmental Protection Act 1996
rows: Aimed at avoidance and reduction of environmental pollution, amongst other issues relevant to the protection of the natural environment, the Act lies out the rules for handling waste, specifies the care of the biological environment, and the prevention and control of soil and water pollution.

title: Environmental Promotion Act
rows: Federal law on the promotion of measures in the areas of water management, the environment, the remediation of contaminated sites, land recycling, biodiversity and environmental protection abroad as well as on the Austrian JI/CDM program for climate protection.

title: Mineral Resources Act
rows: IV. Section regulates securing the use of the surface after the end of the mining activity, specifying that land and parts of land required for mining purposes must be restored to their former condition, provided these have not been used to mine deposits of mineral raw materials. If the restoration of the previous condition cannot be achieved or is not economically justifiable, or if such a plan contradicts existing spatial planning, the land and parts of the land must be made usable again in another way. Properties and parts of properties on which a deposit of mineral raw materials has been mined must be designed in a nature-friendly and landscape-appropriate manner. In particular, embankments are to be made stable.

title: Salzburg Nature Conservation Act 1999
rows: This law serves to protect and care for the native nature and the man-made cultural landscape. Through protection and care measures in mind of this law are to be preserved, secured in the long term, improved and, if possible, restored: -the diversity, uniqueness and beauty and the recreational value of nature, -natural or traditional habitats for humans, animals and plants, -the richness of species in the native flora and fauna, with special consideration of species of common interest (Article I lit g of the EU Habitats Directive) and -the efficiency and self-regulating ability of nature as well as a largely undisturbed ecosystem. Minerals and fossils are also subject to the protection of this law.

title: Carinthian Nature Conservation Act 2002
rows: Imposes an obligation on everyone, as bearers of private rights (and obligations), to promote the protection, protect and care for nature in accordance with the provisions of this law. Additionally, state and the municipalities are obliged to ensure the protection and care of nature within the scope of performing the tasks incumbent on them under state law; the state is responsible for monitoring the conservation status of natural habitats and safeguarding the biodiversity of wild animals and plants, among other things by promoting the necessary research and scientific work, with priority habitat types and priority species being given special consideration. Furthermore, the law specifies that remediation of damage to protected species or natural habitats shall be achieved by restoring the protected species or natural habitats to their baseline condition through primary remediation, supplementary remediation or compensatory remediation.

title: Wetlands as a habitat for waterfowl and wading birds - Ramsar Convention
rows: Wetlands as a habitat for waterfowl and wading birds - Ramsar Convention

This legislation ratifies the Ramsar Convention, provides a list of Austrian wetlands of international importance and a list of Ramsar Sites of International Importance under Article 2(5) of the Convention on Wetlands, particularly as Habitats for Waterfowl and Shorebirds

title: Environmental Code Act
rows: The purposes of this Act include the preservation and protection of natural diversity, as well as the prevention of damage to the environment and the remedying of damage caused to the environment.

title: Nature Protection Act
rows: The Act defines protected natural objects and specifies prerequisites for placing them under protection. More specifically, it defines protected areas as areas maintained in a state unaltered by human activity or used subject to special requirements where the natural environment is preserved, protected, restored, researched or introduced.

title: Earth's Crust Act
rows: This Act regulates, inter alia, restoration of the land disturbed by geological investigation, geological exploration or mining. It defines "restoration of disturbed land" as meaning to render the land usable.

title: Forest Act
rows: This Act regulates the directing of forestry, forest survey and management and compensating the damage caused to the environment within the meaning of this Act, and provides for liability for violation of this Act.

title: Environmental Charges Act
rows: This Act defines environmental charge as the price of the right of use of the environment and divides them into natural resource charges and the pollution charges. The Act establishes rates for natural resource charges which are contingent on the situation, place of use, quality and deficiency of the reserves of natural resources, the environmental hazards of the manner of use and the need to protect other natural resources.

title: Environmental Liability Act
rows: The Act regulates the prevention and remedy of environmental damage. It defines remedying of environmental damage as the taking of measures to restore, replace or compensate for natural resources or the benefits thereof and to eliminate significant risks threatening human health (hereinafter remedial measures).

title: Law on the Conservation of Species and Biotopes
rows: Law on the Conservation of Species and Biotopes

The Law specifies procedures for the determination of the specially protected species and biotopes and defines the conservation of species and biotopes as a series of measures required for the preservation or restoration of populations and biotopes in an optimal state.

title: Environmental Protection Law
rows: The purpose of this Law is to ensure the preservation and recovery of the quality of the environment, and also sustainable use of natural resources. It defines 'remedial measures' as measures to prevent damage, recover or decontaminate, rehabilitate or replace natural resources, to which damage has been caused, and functions related to natural resources, which have impaired, also the measures for the reduction, prevention of damage and temporary measures, or provision of equivalent alternatives for these resources or functions related to natural resources.

title: On Specially Protected Nature Territories
rows: The subject-matter of this Law are specially protected nature territories. Protected territories are geographically specified areas that, in accordance with a decision of competent State authorities and administrative bodies, are under the special protection of the State and are established, protected and managed for the purpose of: - protection and preservation of natural diversity (rare and typical natural ecosystems; living environment of protected species; original, beautiful landscapes characteristic of Latvia; geological and geomorphological formations, etc.); - ensuring supervision of scientific research and the environment; - preservation of territories significant for the recreation, education and instruction of society.

title: Cabinet Regulation No. 264 of 2010 on General Regulations on Protection and Use of Specially Protected Nature Territories
rows: Cabinet Regulation No. 264 of 2010 on General Regulations on Protection and Use of Specially Protected Nature Territories

The Regulation prescribes the procedures for protection and use of specially protected nature territories, including types of permissible and prohibited activities in protected territories, as well as the sample of a special informative sign used for marking of protected territories on site and the procedures for the development and use thereof.

title: Protection Zone Law
rows: The Law defines protection zones/belts to be intended areas destined for protection of different objects (either natural or artificial) against negative external impact, ensuring safe operation and security thereof, protection of environment and human beings against negative impact. It classifies protection belts, modalities of keeping and control of the state thereof, and restriction of economic activity in protection zones.

title: Law on Forests
rows: Chapter VI of the Law imposes an obligation on a forest owner or lawful possessor to regenerate a forest stand after felling or impact of other factors if the basal area of the forest stand has become smaller than the critical basal area, as well as to ensure tending of the regenerated forest stand or the forest stand established by afforestation.

title: Amelioration Law
rows: The Lw defines 'land amelioration' as land improvement, reducing the adverse effects of climatic conditions and ensuring long-term use of natural resources. The purpose of the Law is to ensure such mechanism for the management of amelioration systems, which promotes sustainable management and use of natural resources, ensures the water regime necessary for the safety and welfare of inhabitants, development of infrastructure, as well as construction, operation, maintenance, and management of amelioration systems.

title: Plant Protection Law
rows: The Law provides that in Latvia it is prohibited to cultivate the species included in the list of invasive plant species. It specifies that for habitat conservation and restoration, eradication of invasive species is necessary. The land owner or possessor is obliged to eradicate invasive plant species, if they occur on their land.

title: Act to affirm the collective nature of water resources and to promote better governance of water and associated environments
rows: Act to affirm the collective nature of water resources and to promote better governance of water and associated environments

The legislation emphasizes the importance of conserving and restoring land and ecosystems associated with water resources. It promotes integrated management, recognizing the interconnectedness between water, land, and ecosystems. The legislation aims to support land and ecosystem restoration efforts while ensuring better governance of water resources.

title: ACT RESPECTING THE PRESERVATION OF AGRICULTURAL LAND AND AGRICULTURAL ACTIVITIES
rows: ACT RESPECTING THE PRESERVATION OF AGRICULTURAL LAND AND AGRICULTURAL ACTIVITIES

The "Act Respecting the Preservation of Agricultural Land and Agricultural Activities" focuses on protecting agricultural land and activities. While its primary aim is to preserve farmland, it indirectly supports ecosystem restoration by maintaining agricultural landscapes that contribute to biodiversity, soil health, water quality, and ecosystem services.

title: PROVINCIAL FOREST USE REGULATION
rows: The Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act, along with the Provincial Forest Use Regulation, governs the management of forests in British Columbia. It promotes sustainable forest practices, including the protection of ecosystems and the restoration of disturbed forest areas. The legislation aims to balance economic, social, and environmental considerations in forest management.

title: The Crown Lands Act
rows: The Crown Lands Act in Manitoba, Canada, governs the management of Crown lands. It defines terms, establishes the Lands Branch, allows reservations and withdrawals, grants the minister control over land sales and leases, and sets authorization requirements for certain transactions.

title: An Act mainly to end petroleum exploration and production and the public financing of those activities
rows: An Act mainly to end petroleum exploration and production and the public financing of those activities

The Act is mainly to end petroleum exploration and production, and the public financing of those activities is legislation in Canada that aims to stop petroleum exploration and production while prohibiting public funding for such activities. It focuses on reducing environmental impacts, promoting alternative energy sources, and restoring affected ecosystems.

title: Natural Heritage Conservation Act
rows: The Natural Heritage Conservation Act of Quebec aims to conserve Quebec's natural heritage, including land and ecosystems. It promotes the expansion of protected areas, citizen involvement, and collaboration among government departments. While the Act recognizes the importance of land and ecosystem restoration, it does not provide specific details on restoration methods. The Act emphasizes the need to conserve natural heritage for future generations and adapt to climate change. More specific guidelines and regulations may be developed to address restoration activities.

title: Conservation Easements Act, SNS 2001, c 28
rows: The Conservation Easements Act of Nova Scotia (SNS 2001, c 28) encompasses various ecosystems found within the province, including forests, wetlands, coastlines, riparian zones, grasslands, and biodiversity hotspots. The Act aims to conserve these ecosystems and their ecological integrity, biodiversity, and natural values.

title: The Manitoba Habitat Heritage Act
rows: The Manitoba Habitat Heritage Act establishes The Manitoba Habitat Heritage Corporation with the goal of conserving, restoring, and enhancing fish and wildlife habitat in Manitoba. The corporation has the power to manage habitat on Crown land and private land, initiate or support projects, disseminate public information, and acquire or dispose of real property. It operates under a board of directors and can establish funds for its operations. The Act aims to promote land and ecosystem restoration in Manitoba.

title: Act on the Remediation of Certain Environmental Damages
rows: Act on the Remediation of Certain Environmental Damages

This Act regulates the remediation of damage caused to the environment, which includes damage to protected species and natural habitats referred to in section 5a of the Nature Conservation Act. It defines primary remediation - natural resources and natural resource services shall be restored to the baseline condition by removing the harmful change caused by the damage and complementary remediation - if the baseline condition cannot be fully restored, the impairment that the damage has caused to the natural resource and natural resource service shall be compensated for by measures taken at the damaged site or elsewhere.

title: Act on Compensation for Environmental Damage
rows: Act on Compensation for Environmental Damage

The Act dictates that compensation will be paid for a loss defined as environmental damage, caused by activities carried out in a certain area and resulting from pollution of the water, air or soil. By virtue of the Act compensation will be paid for the costs of the measures needed to prevent environmental damage threatening the person undertaking the measures, or to reinstate a damaged environment.

title: Act on Environmental Administration
rows: The Act promotes sustainable development, sustainable use of natural resources and environmental protection, preservation of biodiversity and functional capacity as well as the beauty and cultural values of the environment, develops the human living environment and community structure, and takes care of the use and management of water resources.

title: Act on the Environmental Protection of Antarctica
rows: Act on the Environmental Protection of Antarctica

The objective of this law is the comprehensive protection of the Antarctic environment and the ecosystems that depend on it and associated with it. It refers to significant damage to land-based native plant deposits; any other activity resulting in a significant adverse change in the habitat of a species or population native to the Antarctic; as well as mineral deposit, i.e. all non-living and non-renewable natural resources.

title: Nature Conservation Act
rows: This law applies to the protection and management of nature and landscape. It implements Council the EU Habitats Directive, the EU Birds Directive, with the exception of Paragraph 615 of the Hunting Act (1993/5), and Directive 2004/35/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage ('the ELD'), unless its implementation is otherwise provided for by law.

title: Environmental Protection Decree
rows: The Decree regulates the notification on the restoration of contaminated soil as referred to in section 78 of the Environmental Protection Act. It states that the notification must also be accompanied by: 1) details of the property on which the contaminated soil is located, the planned use for the area, and the neighbours of the property; 2) details of the substance and events which caused the pollution; 3) detailed results of research to establish the extent and degree of pollution in the soil and groundwater.

title: Law no. 74/2019 Regarding the Management of Potentially Contaminated and Contaminated Sites
rows: Law no. 74/2019 Regarding the Management of Potentially Contaminated and Contaminated Sites

This law provides measures at the national level regarding identification of potentially contaminated sites and those contaminated in order to create a national inventory of them. It defines and establishes objectives regarding the remediation of contaminated sites, including land previously occupied by a landfill. It states that the polluter has the obligation to bear the costs of remediation of contaminated sites that are the subject of a feasibility study and a remediation project, developed after a detailed investigation and risk assessment.

title: Law no. 246/2020 Regarding the Use, Conservation and Protection of Soil
rows: Law no. 246/2020 Regarding the Use, Conservation and Protection of Soil

The Law establishes a framework of measures and actions for, inter alia, restoration and recovery of lands affected by degradation as a result of rain and wind erosion, lack or excess of moisture, decrease in the content of organic matter and nutrients, reduction of biodiversity, compaction, acidification, sodification, alkalization, desertification, landslides and lands affected by microorganisms such as dangerous viruses, bacteria and fungi. It specifies central public administration authorities, in particular for environmental protection, agriculture and rural development, have the responsibility to promote programs of measures to prevent, reduce risk, combat soil degradation and pollution, restore degraded lands and restore lands affected by landslides and provides tools/mechanisms for their implementation.

title: LAW no. 138 on Land Improvements (republished on April 27, 2004)
rows: LAW no. 138 on Land Improvements (republished on April 27, 2004)

The Law establishes the National Land Improvement Administration, a Romanian legal entity of national public interest in the land improvement sector, which carries out activities which include operation, maintenance and repairs of land improvement facilities declared to be of public utility and making investments for the rehabilitation of existing land improvement facilities and the execution of new facilities.

title: Law no 46/2008 THE FORESTRY CODE (republished on March 19, 2008)
rows: Law no 46/2008 THE FORESTRY CODE (republished on March 19, 2008)

The Law aims to prevent the irreversible degradation of forests, as a result of human actions and destabilizing environmental factors. It defines state forestry forests - from the structure of the National Forestry Authority (Romsilva), the Autonomous Authority "State Protocol Heritage Administration", as well as the Institute of Forestry Research and Management, which is being reorganized into the "Marin Drcea" National Forestry Research and Development Institute. It also regulates regime forestry enclaves - which are established by administrative/territorial units, by individuals or legal entities that own forest funds or by associations established by them.

title: EMERGENCY ORDINANCE no. 236 of November 24, 2000
rows: This emergency ordinance lays out rules for - maintaining or restoring to a state of favourable conservation of natural habitats and species of wild flora and fauna; - the establishment, organization and expansion of the national network of protected natural areas, as well as the regulation of its regime; - the administration regime of protected natural areas and the procedures for establishing the protection regime for other natural areas and assets of the natural heritage; - measures for the protection and conservation of endangered, vulnerable, endemic and/or rare species of wild animals and plants, as well as those for the protection of geomorphological and landscape formations of ecological, scientific, aesthetic, cultural-historical and other nature interest, of assets natural objects of speleological, paleontological, geological, anthropological interest and other natural assets with natural heritage value, existing within the perimeters of protected natural areas and/or outside them; etc.

title: EMERGENCY ORDINANCE no. 57 of June 20, 2007 regarding the regime of natural protected areas, conservation of natural habitats, flora and fauna
rows: EMERGENCY ORDINANCE no. 57 of June 20, 2007 regarding the regime of natural protected areas, conservation of natural habitats, flora and fauna

This Law ensures full compatibility of the Romanian legislation with that of the European Union in the field of nature protection and taking into account the provisions of Directive 79/409/EEC on the conservation of wild birds (EU Birds Directive) and Directive 92/43/EEC regarding the conservation of natural habitats and species of wild flora and fauna (EU Habitats Directive).

title: DECISION no. 1,284 of October 24, 2007 - Natura 2000 sites
rows: DECISION no. 1,284 of October 24, 2007 - Natura 2000 sites
The decision declares the list of special protection areas as an integral part of the European Natura 2000 ecological network in Romania.

title: ORDER no. 552 of August 26, 2003 on internal zoning of national parks and natural parks
rows: ORDER no. 552 of August 26, 2003 on internal zoning of national parks and natural parks

The Order specifies that the internal zoning of national parks and natural parks is approved from the point of view of the need to preserve natural ecosystems and biological diversity, by delimiting special conservation areas, according to the annex. The Order determines that until the approval of the management plan for each national park or natural park, which will regulate in detail the protection regime and the detailed zoning, any forms of exploitation or use of natural resources are prohibited, as well as any forms of land use, incompatible with the purpose of protection and/or conservation.

title: DECISION no. 2,151 of November 30, 2004
rows: The Order deals with the establishment of new protected natural areas and states that nntil the approval of the management plans of the national and natural parks, which will regulate in detail the protection regime and the detailed zoning, in the special conservation areas, any forms of exploitation or use of natural resources are prohibited, as well as any forms of land use, incompatible with the purpose of protection and/or conservation.

title: DECISION no. 1,586 of November 8, 2006
rows: This legislation orders the inclusion of some protected natural areas in the category of wetlands of international importance - Ramsar sites.

title: LAW No. 5 of January 25, 1991 - ratifying Ramsar Convention
rows: LAW No. 5 of January 25, 1991 - ratifying Ramsar Convention
The Law confirms Romania's accession to the Convention on Wetlands, particularly with regards to the habitat for waterfowl.

title: LAW no. 137 of July 1, 2010
rows: The law confirms ratification of PROTOCOL of June 19, 2008 on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity and landscape diversity at the Framework Convention on the Protection and Sustainable Development of the Carpathians, adopted in Kyiv on May 22. The Protocol focuses on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity and landscape diversity and its aim is to intensify the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of the biological and landscape diversity of the Carpathians.

title: LAW no. 389 of October 19, 2006 - ratifying CONVENTION 22/05/2003
rows: LAW no. 389 of October 19, 2006 - ratifying CONVENTION 22/05/2003

As a party to the Framework Convention on the Protection and Sustainable Development of the Carpathians, adopted in Kyiv on May 22, 2003 this law obliges Romania to implement policies aimed at the conservation, sustainable use and restoration of biological diversity and landscapes in the Carpathians.

title: Nature Diversity Act
rows: The Act defines national parks, protected landscapes, nature reserves, habitat management areas and a framework for their conservation. Specifically, it prohibits any activity that has a lasting impact on the natural environment, unless such impact is essential to achieving the purpose of protection or restoration.

title: Forestry Act
rows: The Act regulates forestry activities, defines terms such as forest inventory and forest management plan and lays out rules for regeneration and silviculture of forest. Specifically, it states that the forest owner shall ensure satisfactory regeneration after felling, and ensure that there is a correlation between the logging method and the method of regeneration. It specifies that the Ministry of Agriculture and Food may issue further regulations concerning regeneration and management of forest, including requirements regarding satisfactory regeneration, change of tree species, use of foreign tree species, digging of ditches in forest, fertilization of forest, use of pesticides in forest and the supply of seeds and seedlings for forestry purposes.

title: Svalbard Environmental Protection Act
rows: The purpose of this Act is to preserve a virtually untouched environment in Svalbard with respect to continuous areas of wilderness, landscape, flora, fauna and cultural heritage. The Act states that any person that has had an impact on the environment in Svalbard by contravening provisions laid down in or under this Act shall take the remedial action necessary to prevent further environmental impact and, if possible, to restore the original state of the environment by appropriate action such as collection, clearing up, removal, the release of organisms, or levelling the ground.

title: The Land Act
rows: Chapter IV deals with protection of cultivated and cultivable land, etc. Specifically, Section 10 Excavation of bogs states: When a person excavates bogs for peat products or other technical purposes layer of peat or soil shall always be left. The bog area shall be restored with a view to future use of the land for agricultural purposes and nature conservation.

title: LAND PROTECTION Legislation
rows: This law regulates soil protection, systematic monitoring of soil condition and quality, remediation measures, remediation, recultivation, inspection supervision and other matters of importance for the protection and preservation of soil as a natural resource of national interest. The aim of this law is to preserve the surface and functions of the soil as a natural resource and to prevent or eliminate harmful changes in the soil.

title: AGRICULTURAL LAND Legislation
rows: This law regulates the planning, protection, arrangement and use of agricultural land, supervision over the implementation of this law and other issues of importance for the protection, arrangement and use of agricultural land as a good of general interest.

title: ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION Legislation
rows: This law regulates an integral system of environmental protection, which ensures the realization of the human right to life and development in a healthy environment and a balanced relationship between economic development and the environment in the Republic of Serbia. The environmental protection system consists of measures, conditions and instruments for: 1) sustainable management, preservation of natural balance, integrity, diversity and quality of natural values

title: Forest Legislation
rows: This law regulates the preservation, protection, planning, cultivation and use of forests, disposal of forests and forest land, supervision over the implementation of this law, as well as other issues important for forests and forest land. Preservation, protection and improvement of the state of forests, the use of all the potential of forests and their functions, and the establishment of new forests in order to achieve optimal forest cover, spatial distribution and structure of the forest fund in the Republic of Serbia, are activities of general interest.

title: Agriculture land Legislation
rows: This Law regulates the maintenance and protection of agricultural land, use of agricultural land, change of use of agricultural land and compensation, disposal of agricultural land owned by the Republic of Croatia and the Land Fund.

title: Forest Legislation
rows: This Law regulates the cultivation, protection, use and disposal of forests and forest lands as natural resources, with the aim of maintaining biological diversity and ensuring management based on the principles of economic sustainability, social responsibility and ecological acceptability

title: PROTECTION OF NATURE Legislation
rows: This Law regulates the system of protection and integral preservation of nature and its parts, as well as other related issues. The goals and tasks of nature protection are: - preserve and/or restore biodiversity, landscape diversity and geodiversity in a state of natural balance and harmonious relationships with human activity, - determine and monitor the state of nature, - ensure a system of nature protection for its permanent preservation, - to ensure the sustainable use of natural resources without significant damage to parts of nature and with as little disturbance as possible of the balance of its components, - to contribute to the preservation of the naturalness of the soil, the preservation of the quality, quantity and availability of water, the sea, the preservation of the atmosphere and the production of oxygen, and the preservation of the climate, - to prevent or alleviate harmful interference by people and disturbances in nature as a consequence of technological development and performance of activities.

title: PROTECTION OF NATURE Legislation
rows: This law regulates the protection and preservation of nature. Nature protection is carried out in order to: - preservation and improvement of biological (genetic, species, ecosystem), geological and the precincts of diversity; - determining and monitoring the state of nature; - harmonization of human activities, economic and social development plans, programs, basis and projects with sustainable use of renewables and rational use non-renewable natural values

title: ENVIRONMENT Legislation
rows: The objectives of environmental protection are: - preservation and protection of human health, integrity, diversity and quality of the ecosystem, gene pool animal and plant species, soil fertility, natural beauty and spatial values, cultural heritage and goods created by man; - provision of conditions for limited, reasonable and sustainable management of living and non-living nature, preservation of ecological stability of nature, quantity and quality of natural resources and prevention hazards and risks to the environment.

title: Forest Legislation
rows: This law regulates the cultivation, protection, preservation and improvement of forests, planning, methods and conditions forest use, construction and maintenance of forest roads, forest monitoring, as well as other important issues for forests, forest land and forestry. This law also applies to the protection, preservation and use of forest trees located outside the forest and forest land

title: Agricultural land Legislation
rows: Agricultural land, as an asset of general interest, enjoys special protection and is used under conditions and in a manner prescribed by this law.

title: Lacey Act Amendments
rows: The Lacey Act Amendment in the USA focuses on combating illegal wildlife trade and protecting endangered species. While it doesn't directly address land and ecosystem restoration, it indirectly contributes to these efforts by preventing the illegal trade of plants and wildlife, including timber. By reducing deforestation, biodiversity loss, and habitat destruction, it helps in preserving ecosystems. Additionally, it promotes the conservation of endangered species, indirectly supporting ecosystem restoration

title: Innovative Stormwater Infrastructure Act
rows: The Innovative Stormwater Infrastructure Act in the USA promotes sustainable stormwater management techniques, including nature-based approaches like green infrastructure. These practices help restore land and ecosystems by reducing runoff and improving water quality.

title: Pipeline Safety Improvement Act
rows: The Pipeline Safety Improvement Act in the USA aims to enhance the safety and regulation of pipelines. While it doesn't directly address land and ecosystem restoration, it strives to prevent pipeline incidents and minimize their environmental impact. By implementing stricter safety standards and promoting proper maintenance, the act indirectly contributes to the protection of land and ecosystems.

title: Land Restoration and Resiliency Act of 2023
rows: Land Restoration and Resiliency Act of 2023

This bill establishes the Community Resilience and Restoration Fund through cooperative agreements between the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service and the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation. The fund aims to improve community safety, protect and restore resilience lands, and enhance wildlife biodiversity. Grants will be awarded to eligible entities for projects and activities that support these objectives.

title: FOREST LANDSCAPE RESTORATION ACT
rows: The purpose of this Act is to promote collaborative and science-based ecosystem restoration of priority forest landscapes. The Act aims to achieve ecological, economic, and social sustainability, leverage local and national resources, reduce wildfire management costs, and evaluate the effectiveness of ecological restoration techniques and the use of forest restoration byproducts.

title: FEDERAL LANDS FOREST HEALTH PROTECTION AND RESTORATION ACT 104th Congress (1995-1996)
rows: FEDERAL LANDS FOREST HEALTH PROTECTION AND RESTORATION ACT 104th Congress (1995-1996)

This Act aims to restore and maintain the health of Federal lands, ensuring their sustainability and protecting various resources and values associated with them. It seeks to address declining forest health, mitigate risks to human life and property, preserve ecosystems, watersheds, and habitats, and manage Federal lands consistently through authorized legislation.

title: COMMUNITY FOREST RESTORATION ACT
rows: The purposes of this Act are to promote healthy watersheds, reduce the threat of wildfires and infestation, improve forest ecosystems, enhance biodiversity, facilitate communication and collaboration for forest restoration, utilize small diameter trees effectively, encourage sustainable communities and forests through partnerships, and develop ecologically sound restoration techniques.

title: Collaborative Forest Landscape Restoration Program Reauthorization Act of 2023
rows: Collaborative Forest Landscape Restoration Program Reauthorization Act of 2023

This bill reauthorizes and expands the Collaborative Forest Landscape Restoration program, funding collaborative and community-based forest management. Proposals must address pathogen invasions, and special consideration is given to innovative approaches, wildfire risk reduction, ecological restoration, and watershed health. The bill increases the number of funded proposals per fiscal year.

title: Protect the West Act of 2023
rows: This bill establishes funding programs, including the Restoration and Resilience Grant Program and the Restoration and Resilience Partnership Program, to support restoration and resilience projects. It creates an advisory council and a funding source called the Outdoor and Watershed Restoration Fund. The programs aim to increase capacity for project planning and coordination, improve wildfire resistance, and restore wildlife habitat.

title: Black Soil Protection Law of China
rows: Black Soil Protection Law of China

This law aims to protect the black land resources and ensure national food security by taking measures such as engineering, agronomy, agricultural machinery, and biology to protect the excellent production capacity of black land and ensure that the total amount of black land does not decrease and its functions do not degrade.

title: Environmental Protection Law of the People's Republic of China
rows: Environmental Protection Law of the People's Republic of China

The legislation states the requirement of strict protection on key ecological functional zones, areas of sensitive and fragile ecological environment. (Article 29). Also, For construction projects that proceed to commence the construction of the projects prior to submitting EIA reports or having such reports approved, competent government departments with environmental protection supervision responsibility shall order them to stop the construction, impose fine penalty, and may require restoration of the construction sites (Article 61).

title: Forestry Act (1979:429)
rows: The Act regulates planting of new forests if the wood-producing capacity of the land after felling or due to damage to the forest is not used in an, acceptable way, if the land is unused, or if the condition of the forest is clearly unsatisfactory. It specifies that the owner of the productive forest land is responsible for the establishment and maintenance of new forest.

title: Environmental Code (1998:808)
rows: The Act defines national parks, nature reserves, biotope protection areas, as well as special protection areas relative to the EU Habitats and the EU Birds Directive. It specifies provision that put responsibility for remedial action on whoever conducts or has conducted an activity or taken a measure that has contributed to pollution damage or serious environmental damage (the operator). Furthermore, Whoever is responsible for remedying serious environmental damage must carry out or pay for the remedial work necessary to restore the environment to the condition it would have been in if the damage had not occurred, compensate for lost environmental values

title: Forestry Ordinance (1993:1096)
rows: The Ordinance lays out obligations of the Norwegian Forestry Agency, which include regulations on rejuvenation method, land preparation, sowing, planting, care of seedling forest and other measures needed to ensure regrowth.

title: Forest Resources Creation and Management Act
rows: Forest Resources Creation and Management Act
The legislation includes the establishment and implementation of forest reforestation plan, forestry in logging areas, and forest planning and management.

title: Regulation (2022:1826) on the EU's common agricultural policy
rows: Regulation (2022:1826) on the EU's common agricultural policy
The Regulation determines that the share of permanent grassland at national level in relation to the total area of

title: Ordinance (2010:1879) and Ordinance (2016:868) on support for certain measures in forestry
rows: Ordinance (2010:1879) and Ordinance (2016:868) on support for certain measures in forestry

The legislation determines that support for natural and cultural environment protection measures within forestry may be provided for measures that go beyond the requirements prescribed in the Forest Protection Act (1979:429) and first afforestation with deciduous forest on land previously used for agricultural purposes, if the afforestation is of value for natural and cultural environmental conservation Ordinance (2016:868).

title: Baekdu-Daegan Protection Act
rows: One of the purpose of this Act is to construct the restoration and recovery of the ecosystems and damaged areas of the Baekdu-daegan. The specific range of protected areas is listed in the Act. Actual operations include the installation of natural environment conservation facilities, such as wildlife passages, facilities for the conservation and utilization of the natural environment, and facilities, etc. for ecological restoration.

title: Forest Law of the People's Republic of China
rows: Forest Law of the People's Republic of China

The law prohibits the actions of violating the regulations by destroying trees, etc. It requires relevant departments to impose penalties on such behaviors, and to arrange afforestation to restore forest vegetation. It also encourages citizens to participate in afforestation and land greening by planting trees, tending and protecting, funding and donating afforestation and cultivation, or other means.

title: LAW N47bis/2013 OF 28/06/2013 Determininig the Management and Utilisation of Forests in Rwanda
rows: LAW N47bis/2013 OF 28/06/2013 Determininig the Management and Utilisation of Forests in Rwanda

The Law provides the framework for the National afforestation program, determined by the Minister and implemented by the Authority. The Law specifies that each District shall determine lands for afforestation and implement the national afforestation and forest management program. The Minister may, if he/she deems it necessary, decide to suspend the harvesting of forests in a given area or prohibit the collection of any forest products from that area in order to allow forests in that area to regenerate.

title: ORGANIC LAW N 04/2005 OF 08/04/2005 Determining the Modalities of Protection, Conservation and Promotion of Environment in Rwanda
rows: ORGANIC LAW N 04/2005 OF 08/04/2005 Determining the Modalities of Protection, Conservation and Promotion of Environment in Rwanda

The Law specifies that any soil development and exploitation project for industrial, urban organisation as well as any research project or the one of exploitation of subsoil raw materials is subject to authorisation issued through procedures determined by the order of the Minister concerned. This authorisation is subject to the obligation to rehabilitate in any possible way in order to restore the beauty of the landscape or the natural systems modified by human activity, in accordance with a pre- established rehabilitation plan approved by the competent authority.

title: LAW N53/2010 OF 25/01/2011 Establishing Rwanda Natural Resources Authority (RNRA)
rows: LAW N53/2010 OF 25/01/2011 Establishing Rwanda Natural Resources Authority (RNRA)

The Law establishes RNRA as the Authority that leads the management of promotion of natural resources which is composed of land, water, forests, mines and geology. RNRA's responsibilities include rehabilitating and conserving where natural resources are damaged in the country.

title: N06/2017 of 03/02/2017 Law establishing Rwanda Water and Forestry Authority
rows: N06/2017 of 03/02/2017 Law establishing Rwanda Water and Forestry Authority

This Law establishes Rwanda Water and Forestry Authority determining its mission, organization and functioning. The responsibilities of the Authority include preparing programmes of reforestation, forest promotion and appropriate management and supporting districts in the management of forests and natural water resources;

title: ORGANIC LAW N 08/2005 OF 14/07/2005 Determining the Use and Management of Land in Rwanda
rows: ORGANIC LAW N 08/2005 OF 14/07/2005 Determining the Use and Management of Land in Rwanda

The Law defines Public Land to conserve environment and culture as the land that should be particularly protected, swamps and any other wetland, the land to preserve animals and plants like the National Parks and the forests as well as historical sites or areas reserved for cultural sites, Genocide memorials and cemeteries.

title: LAW N 43/2013 OF 16/06/2013 Governing Land in Rwanda
rows: LAW N 43/2013 OF 16/06/2013 Governing Land in Rwanda

The Law states that if it is clear that the land is degraded or its disuse is a cause of insecurity, the Minister in charge of land may requisition it. The requisitioned land may be assigned to another person who so requests and who demonstrates ability to efficiently conserve it and productively exploit it.

title: Land Use Planning Act, 2007
rows: Subject to the provisions of this Act, a planning authority may issue and serve on any person a land restoration order in respect of any matter relating to the management or use of land. A land restoration order may require a person to whom it is served to restore land, including replacement of soil, the replanting of trees and other flora; and the restoration as far as may be possible of outstanding geographical, archaeological or historical features of the land or the area contiguous to the land as may be specified in the particular order.

title: RESTORE OUR PARKS ACT
rows: The RESTORE OUR PARKS Act focuses on addressing the maintenance backlog in national parks and supporting land and ecosystem restoration efforts within these parks. It aims to fund infrastructure improvements and promote the long-term health and sustainability of these natural landscapes.

title: Seedlings for Sustainable Habitat Restoration Act of 2023
rows: Seedlings for Sustainable Habitat Restoration Act of 2023

The Seedlings for Sustainable Habitat Restoration Act of 2023 (S.1164) authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to enter into contracts, grants, and agreements for ecosystem restoration activities. This includes collecting and maintaining native seeds and producing seedlings for revegetation. The bill aims to support collaborative efforts with state forestry agencies, private organizations, and educational institutions.

title: THE ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT ACT, 2004
rows: The Act defines the right to clean, safe and healthy environment and the right to bring an action on environment. It specifies that every person may bring an action against the person whose act or omission is likely to cause harm to human health or the environment. The action may seek to compel the persons responsible for the environmental degradation to restore the degraded environment as far as practicable to its condition immediately prior to the damage. The Act specifies that an environmental restoration order will be issued and will require the person on whom it relates to restore the environment as near as it may be to a state in which it was before the taking of the action which is the subject of the order. An environmental restoration order may require a person on whom it relates to restore land, including the replacement of soil, replanting of trees and other flora and the restoration as far as may be, of outstanding geological, archaeological or historical features of the land or the area contiguous to the land or sea as may be specified in the order.

title: CONSERVATION AND REINVESTMENT ACT
rows: The Conservation and Reinvestment Act (H.R. 701) was a 2002 bill that aimed to use royalties from offshore oil and gas production for conservation and outdoor recreation. It included provisions for various aspects of conservation, such as impact assistance, coastal conservation, land and water conservation, wildlife restoration, and historic preservation. The bill proposed the establishment of the Conservation and Reinvestment Act Fund to allocate funds to different programs and initiatives.

title: Forest Act 2002
rows: The Act specifies that the Minister, the local authority, or as the case may be, the village council shall attach such conditions to a concession of forest land to ensure that a programme of reforestation is implemented and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing; a concession of forest land may include conditions on afforestation and reforestation, disposal of waste, avoidance of pollution, conservation of flora and fauna within the forest land, etc.

title: Leech Lake Reservation Restoration Technical Corrections Act of 2023
rows: Leech Lake Reservation Restoration Technical Corrections Act of 2023

The Leech Lake Reservation Restoration Technical Corrections Act of 2023 transfers federal land in Minnesota's Chippewa National Forest to the Leech Lake Band of Ojibwe. The bill rectifies land sales without the rightful owners' consent. The Department of Agriculture will substitute unsuitable land with suitable alternatives on an acre-for-acre basis. Land transfers can happen gradually as more parcels are identified. These actions will be considered final agency decisions.

title: The Wildlife Conservation Act 2022
rows: The objectives of this Act are, inter alia, to protect and conserve and administer areas with great biological diversity, including wetlands which are representative of the major wildlife habitats. The Act states that, subject to subsections (2) and (3) of section 58 of the Environmental Management Act, the Minister may, in consultation with the Minister responsible for environment, cause to be made regulations and guidelines prescribing for establishment of sustainable management of wetlands reserves and wetlands area.

title: COMMUNITY-BASED FOREST AND PUBLIC LANDS RESTORATION ACT
rows: COMMUNITY-BASED FOREST AND PUBLIC LANDS RESTORATION ACT

The Community Based Forest and Public Lands Restoration Act (S. 2672) is a legislation focused on promoting collaboration between federal land management agencies and rural communities for the restoration of forests and public lands. It aims to reduce wildfire risk, establish healthy ecosystems, and involve local communities in natural resource management. The bill introduces new programs and funding for restoration efforts, emphasizing communication and cooperation. It seeks to address concerns and needs of communities while promoting ecosystem restoration.

title: Mining Act 2010
rows: In accordance with this Act the Minister may make regulations which may provide for the avoidance of pollution to the air, surface and ground waters and soils and the regulation of all matters relating to the protection of the environment and the minimisation of all adverse impacts to the environment including the restoration of land on which mining operations have been conducted.

title: Environmental Management Act 2011
rows: The Act gives the Minister in charge the responsibility to make regulations providing for insitu conservation of biological diversity which cover rehabilitation and restoration of degraded ecosystems and promotion of the recovery of threatened species through the development and implementation of plans or other management strategies. It defines site restoration orders which are issued in instances where waste is deposited in any place in contravention of this Act or any condition of a waste management licence or a hazardous waste management licence. Furthermore, it defines environmental restoration orders that are served where there is a discharge of a contaminant or pollutant into the environment in an amount, concentration or manner that constitutes a risk to human health or property, or that causes or has the potential to cause adverse effects. The order obliges the pollutant to take any measures that will assist in reducing or eliminating the risk or harm and to take any measures to restore land, including the replacement of soil, the replanting of trees and other flora and the restoration as far as may be, of outstanding geological, archaeological or historical features of the land or the area contiguous to the land or area as may be specified in the particular order.

title: Environmental Protection and Pollution Control Act
rows: Environmental Protection and Pollution Control Act

The Act defines "rehabilitation" as the restoration of natural resources to their original state or to a reasonable state acceptable to the Inspectorate and establishes the Environmental Council. Its responsibilities include to monitor dereliction of land and where derelict land exists, assess the nature of rehabilitation works required; monitor land contamination and where such contamination exists, assess the nature of any rehabilitation works required.

title: The Mines and Minerals Development Act, 2015
rows: The Mines and Minerals Development Act, 2015

The Act specifies the conditions subject to which the mining right is granted or renewed shall include he rehabilitation, levelling, re grassing, reforesting or contouring of such part of the land over which the right or licence has effect as may have been damaged or adversely affected by exploration operations, mining operations or mineral processing operations. Additionally, it states that where any harm or damage is caused to the environment or biological diversity, compensation shall include the cost of reinstatement, rehabilitation or clean-up measures which are incurred and where applicable, the costs of preventive measures.

title: The Forest Act, 2015
rows: The Act makes the Forestry Department responsible for advising on areas required to be protected as National Forests, Local Forests, botanical reserves or community forests and the policies required to ensure the conservation and sustainable use of forest resources in those areas, as well as adopting and promoting methods for the sustainability, conservation and preservation of ecosystems and biological diversity in forest areas and open areas.

title: The Zambia Wildlife Act, 2015
rows: The Act provides regulations for the implementation of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora and the Convention on Wetlands of International Importance especially as Waterfowl Habitat.

title: Environmental Management Act
rows: The Act provides the basis for the National Environmental Plan, which shall formulate strategies and measures for the management, protection, restoration and rehabilitation of the environment, including measures for the protection of ecological processes, natural systems and the natural beauty as well as the preservation of biotic diversity in the natural environment.

title: Forest Act (Chapter 19-05)
rows: The Act provides the basis for the conservation of timber resources and the compulsory afforestation of private land. It specifies that if the Minister considers that the cutting, or the method of cutting, of indigenous timber on private land will result, inter alia, in general deterioration of the locality, he may give written orders to the owner or occupier which include, but are not limited to, the prohibition against or restriction of cutting trees on the land the afforestation or re-forestation of the land.

title: Parks and Wildlife Act (Chapter 20:14)
rows: The Act aims to provide for the establishment of national parks, botanical reserves, botanical gardens, sanctuaries, safari areas and recreational parks; to make provision for the preservation, conservation, propagation or control of the wild life, fish and plants of Zimbabwe and the protection of her natural landscape and scenery; to give certain powers to intensive conservation area committees;

title: Communal Land Forest Produce Area (Chapter 19:04)
rows: The Act defines protected forest areas and states that the Minister may, by notice in the Gazette, declare any area of natural forest described in the notice to be a protected forest area wherein the exploitation of all major forest produce, by all persons or any classes of per-sons that may be specified in the notice, is prohibited.

title: 1816 CHESAPEAKE CLEAN WATER AND ECOSYSTEM RESTORATION ACT
rows: 1816 CHESAPEAKE CLEAN WATER AND ECOSYSTEM RESTORATION ACT

The Committee on Environment and Public Works has recommended the passage of bill S. 1816, which aims to amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to improve and reauthorize the Chesapeake Bay Program. The Chesapeake Bay and its watershed face significant ecological challenges, including poor water quality, degraded habitats, and declining populations of fish and shellfish. The bill sets a target date of 2025 for implementing restoration actions to achieve water quality goals. It grants maximum authority and flexibility to Basin States to meet pollution reduction limits and requires federal government involvement through the Chesapeake Bay Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) and accountability measures. The legislation also provides new tools and financial resources to stakeholders, including states, municipalities, developers, and agricultural producers, to support restoration efforts.

title: ELIM NATIVE CORPORATION LAND RESTORATION
rows: H.R. 3090 is a bill that seeks to restore 50,000 acres of land to the Elim Native Corporation, compensating for land that was taken from them in 1929. The bill also allows for the transfer of settlement common stock to Native children, even if parental rights have been terminated. Additionally, it expands the definition of settlement trust, enabling Alaska Native Corporations to establish trusts for the benefit of Native shareholders and their descendants. The bill includes provisions to conserve fish and wildlife habitat and protect natural springs on the conveyed lands.

title: LAKE TAHOE RESTORATION ACT
rows: The Lake Tahoe Restoration Act (S. 1925) aims to restore and protect the environment of Lake Tahoe. It recognizes the lake's importance and addresses issues like water clarity, pollution, forest health, and contamination. The Act promotes collaboration and funding for restoration projects, including erosion control and cleanup efforts.

title: Expediting Forest Restoration and Recovery Act of 2023
rows: Expediting Forest Restoration and Recovery Act of 2023

A bill to amend the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 to require the Secretary of Agriculture to expedite hazardous fuel or insect and disease risk reduction projects on certain National Forest System land, and for other purposes.

title: AGRICULTURAL LAND LAW
rows: This Law establishes: definitions, basic principles and management, protection, use, arrangement, disposal, records, supervision over the implementation of this Law, criminal provisions, transitional and final provisions, as well as other significant issues related to agricultural land on territory of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina

title: THE LAW ABOUT AGRICULTURAL LAND
rows: This law regulates: planning, protection, arrangement, use and disposal of agricultural land, as well as other issues of importance for agricultural land as an asset of general interest

title: LAW ON FORESTS
rows: This law regulates the preservation and protection of forests, the strengthening of their ecological functions, planning in forestry and forest management, economic functions, financing the renewal and improvement of forests in the territory of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, supervision over the implementation of laws, criminal and other issues related to forest management.

title: Law on Forest
rows: This law regulates policy and planning, management and management forests and forest land, forest protection, financing and value of forests, cadastre of forests and forest land and information system in forestry, property-legal relations, as well as other issues of importance for the forest and forestry land for the improvement and sustainable use of forests and forest land and forestry development

This law prescribes the preservation, protection and strengthening of the general functions of forests, planning in forestry, forest management, economic functions, financing the renewal and improvement of forests in the territory of the Brko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina, supervision of law enforcement and other issues. related to forest management

title: ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION LAW
rows: Sustainable development in the field of environment includes: a) preservation of environmental components and strengthening of their ecological functions; b) that pollutant emissions do not exceed the capacity of air, water and soil and their ability to absorb and self-purify, and c) constant preservation of biological diversity, human health, and the quality of air, water and soil according to standards that are always sufficient for the life of people, plant and animal life

This law regulates the protection of the environment in order to preserve it, reduce the risk for life and health of people, and ensuring and improving the quality of life, protection of all elements environment, information and access to information in the field of environmental protection, environmental planning and protection, strategic impact assessment and environmental impact assessment the environment, the procedure for issuing environmental permits and preventing large-scale accidents, the system eco-labelling and management of environmental protection, financing activities related to environment, responsibility for environmental damage, as well as rights and obligations legal and natural persons who perform the activities established by this law

title: Law on Agricultural land
rows: 1) The scope of the law includes agricultural land, as well as - if this law provides for it - real estate that is not agricultural land. (2) This law establishes provisions on the use of agricultural land, land protection, land classification and land protection. (3) * Provisions related to agricultural land - with the exception of the regulations established by this law for the protection and secondary use of land - must also be applied to internal land under agricultural and forestry cultivation.
